Description: Five small fragments of an undyed flax textile (fabric type L) used as a wrapping. The weave is open, plain and balanced and the thread count is warp 8 per10mm and weft 9 per10mm. The spinning direction of warp and weft is 's' and the yarn is fine. The selvedge is plain and has 7 warp cords. A neat selvedge seam sewn with a whip stitch is present on one fragment. The sewing thread used is undyed flax with 2 unspun elements plied in 'z' fashion.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 63)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.71 (excavation object cat. no.)
